sentences.english: You don't get much sleep when the cold and wet are invading every inch of your body.
sentences.chinese: 當寒冷和潮溼浸透你身體的每一寸肌膚時又怎能睡好。

sentences.english: This is really a drenched in blood tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 這真是一個浸透了血淚的悲劇。

sentences.english: Food in Egypt is hot and spicy, drenched in sauces.
sentences.chinese: 埃及食物多辛辣，並要用醬汁浸透。

sentences.english: Wellhung: I'm taking the sopping wet blouse from you. I drop it with a plop.
sentences.chinese: 我把浸透黏液的上衣接過來，撲通一聲扔到地上。

sentences.english: Dyed all thy liquid light with blood and tears.
sentences.chinese: 血和淚浸透了你清澈的雙眸。

sentences.english: Finish up with a cold-water rinse.
sentences.chinese: 浸透頭髮，最後用涼水沖洗乾淨。

sentences.english: Love for one's fellow creatures imbues every line of the drawing .
sentences.chinese: 這張畫的每一根線條都浸透着這種感情。

sentences.english: His shirt was steeped with sweat.
The head with highly absorption, no losses particle, etc.
sentences.chinese: 海綿頭具有高吸水性，易浸透，不掉屑等優點。

sentences.english: Soak dried black mushrooms in hot water. Remove stalks . Drain and set aside.
sentences.chinese: 冬菇用熱水浸透，去蒂，瀝乾水份備用。

sentences.english: Shen Congwen's fictions of "Xiangxi" (the west part of Hunan Province) of subject matters are saturated with the spirit of Daoist art.
sentences.chinese: 沈從文的湘西題材小說浸透了道家藝術精神。

sentences.english: The stationary bed consists of an inert support impregnated with the partitioning liquid .
sentences.chinese: 固定牀是由浸透着分配液的惰性液體所構成。

sentences.english: Soak fungus until soft. Rinse and trim.
sentences.chinese: 浸透雪耳及雲耳，沖洗及修剪。

sentences.english: Camel, soaked with sweat, makes a hand expression for " shush" secretly.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅爾，被汗水浸透，一隻手錶示“噓”祕密地。

sentences.english: The leather disk had been soaked in a mild acid solution of lemon juice.
sentences.chinese: 皮板由於檸檬汁酸性溶液的浸泡而浸透。

sentences.english: But when her bud, soaked in tears, Sabian a sacrifice of snow and rain.
sentences.chinese: 然而當初她的芽兒，浸透了淚泉，灑遍了犧牲的雪雨。

definition: to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
muddy/covered in (mud, dust, sweat, blood etc)/daubed in
to permeate/to percolate/fig. to saturate (with emotion)
